Signor R U B I N I .

In consequence oTtue brilliant reception of Signor R U B I N I , he has been
induced to extend his Engagement for T H R E E N I G H T S MORE, viz. T o M O R R O W , F R I D A Y , and S A T U R D A Y next, being
•

POSITIVELY his LAST A P P E A R A N C E S in this COUNTRY
prior to his return to Paris.

Miss li. P A T O N . the Duetto

Doors to be opener* at Half-past Six o'clock, and the Performances to begin at SEVEN.
Places 'or the Boxes to be taken at the Theatre, Daily, from Ten till Five.
N. B — PRIVATE BOXES may be had Nightly, and FREE ADMISSIONS for the Season,
on application at the BOX-OFFICE.

Mr. BUTLER S

First Appearance at this Theatre having been received with universal
approbation, he will perform R O B R O T on Saturday, and M A C B E T H on
Monday next.
To-Morrow, The QUEEN'S CHAMPION, with MARRIED LIFE, and The MAGPIE ; Or, The Maid
of Palaiseau; Gervas, Mr. Strickland, Richard, Mr. Brindal, Blaisot, Mr. Buckstone, Baillie, Mr.
Webster, l*aac, Mr. Haines, Annette, Mrs. Nisbett, Dame Gervas, Mrs. Tayleure.
On Saturday, the Opera of ROB ROY; Rob Roy, Mr. Butler, Bailie Nicol Jarvie, Mr. Strickland,
Dougal, Mr. Webster, Francis Osbaldistone, Mr. Edwin, Rashleigh Osbaldistone, Mr. Brindal,
Diana Vernon, Miss Eliza Paton, Helen Macgregor, Mrs.W. Clifford, with MARRIED LIFE.
On. Monday, the Tragedy of MACBETH; Macbeth, Mr. Butler, Lady Macbeth, Mrs. Glover, with
MARRIED LIFE.
On Tuesday, The QUEEN'S CHAMPION, with MARRIED LIFE, and RURAL FELICITY.
On. Wednesday, The SLEDGE DRIYER, with (not acted these Two Years) PAUL PRY; Paul Pry,
(on this occasion) Mrs. Glover, and RURAL FELICITY.—In the course of the Evening. Mrs.
Glover will recite ALEXANDER'S FEAST, interspersed with Music, being for the Benefit of
Mrs. Glover.
OnThuradoy, The QUEEN'S CHAMPION, with MARRIED LIFE, and other Entertainments.
W. S. JOHNSON, PRINTER, 6, NASSAU STREET, SOHO.
